category.name: Action
category.description: Features intense scenes, chases, fights, and dangerous situations, focusing on heroes who face extreme challenges to save lives or achieve goals, keeping the viewer constantly on edge.

category.name: Film Noir
category.description: Stories of crime and moral ambiguity, a dark aesthetic with strong lighting contrasts, and tragic or bittersweet endings, reflecting the corruption and pessimism of the society in which they are set.

category.name: Fantasy
category.description: Presents unreal, magical, or supernatural elements, far from reality, with stories that often include mythical creatures, imaginary worlds, or inexplicable phenomena, and aims to transport the viewer to alternative realities.

category.name: Drama
category.description: Focused on human and emotional conflicts, with serious stories that explore the human condition, moral dilemmas, and complex relationships, aiming to evoke an emotional response in the viewer.

category.name: Musical
category.description: Integration of songs, dances, and storytelling, where musical passages advance the plot and express the characters' emotions.

category.name: Suspense
category.description: Keeps the audience in suspense and anticipation, using intriguing plots, characters in danger, and unexpected twists to generate a constant sense of mystery and suspense.

category.name: War
category.description: Shows realistic conflicts, focusing on battles, soldiers, and the impact of war, immersing the viewer in its harsh realities and emotional struggles.

category.name: Adventure
category.description: Presents exciting journeys, exploration of unknown places, and daring challenges, often involving heroes who face risks and discover new worlds, captivating the viewer with suspense and wonder.

category.name: Animation
category.description: Creates moving images through a sequence of drawings, models, or digital resources, allowing great creative freedom to represent worlds, characters, and situations beyond reality.

category.name: Science Fiction
category.description: Explores futuristic worlds, technological advances, space travel, and extraterrestrial beings, using imaginative elements to reflect on the future, society, and human nature.

category.name: Comedy
category.description: Provokes laughter and entertainment, using absurd situations, physical humor, witty dialogue, and caricatured characters, with a light approach and usually a happy ending.

category.name: Western
category.description: Set in the American West of the 19th century, centered on characters like cowboys and gunslingers who face conflicts between civilization and the wild frontier, with stories of morality, duels, and adventures in desert landscapes and frontier towns.

category.name: Romantic
category.description: Stories of love and relationships, exploring the emotional connection between characters and presenting obstacles they must overcome to achieve romantic happiness.

category.name: Terror
category.description: Seeks to provoke fear, tension, or distress in the audience, using supernatural plots, monsters, killers, or terrifying situations to generate an intense emotional response.

category.name: Historical
category.description: Recreates events, characters, and periods from the past, using setting, costumes, and narrative to represent historical facts or relevant figures, often with an educational or interpretive approach.
